Title: As a User, I want to see a Homepage which lists restaurants on gTables
Description:
See the `index.jpg` file inside of the mockups folder. For now, simply hardcode the restaurants. These will eventually be pulled from a database!

__Acceptance Criteria:__
* The page has a title in the navbar
* A link to the New Page is in the navbar
* Restaurants are listed in a three column format
* Each restaurant needs a name, location, category (e.g. Italian), rating, and image.
* The image and title should be clickable and should go the Show page

Title: As a User, I want to see a Show page which displays an individual restaurant
Description:
See the `showOne.jpg` (__not__ `show.jpg`) file inside of the mockups folder. For now, simply hardcode a single restaurant. This will eventually be dynamically loaded!

__Acceptance Criteria:__
* The title in the navbar should be the name of the restaurant
* The user should click the header and go back to the homepage
* An individual restaurant is shown in a two-column format; on the left side is the image and on the right side is information about the restaurant
* Two buttons are show under the restaurant info: Edit and Delete
* The Edit button should go the Edit page

Title: As a User, I want an Edit page where I can edit existing restaurants
Description:
See the `edit.jpg` file inside of the mockups folder. For now, you just need to put form fields.

__Acceptance Criteria:__
* The title in the navbar should be "Edit" + the name of the restaurant (this says "New Restaurant" in the mockup but is incorrect)
* There should be text inputs for name, location (city), and image
* There should be a dropdown select box for state and cuisine -- cuisines include American, Italian, Mexican, Thai, and Vietnamese. Each should __not__ default to a valid selection (i.e. For state, the initial state might be 
* There should be a textarea for a description of the restaurant
* Two buttons should be present: Submit and Cancel. Cancel should bring you back to the Show page and Submit should submit the form

__Validations:__
The following should be validated:
* Name: required, shorter than 40 characters
* Location (City): required, shorter than 40 characters
* Location (State): required
* Cuisine: required
* Rating: required
* Image: required, is a valid url
* Description: required, must not be empty

Title: As a User, I want an New page where I can edit existing restaurants
Description:
See the `new.jpg` file inside of the mockups folder. For now, you just need to put form fields.

__Acceptance Criteria:__
* The title in the navbar should be "New Restaurant"
* There should be text inputs for name, location (city), and image
* There should be a dropdown select box for state and cuisine -- cuisines include American, Italian, Mexican, Thai, and Vietnamese. Each should __not__ default to a valid selection (i.e. For state, the initial state might be 
* There should be a textarea for a description of the restaurant
* Two buttons should be present: Submit and Cancel. Cancel should bring you back to the Homepage and Submit should submit the form

__Validations:__
The following should be validated:
* Name: required, shorter than 40 characters
* Location (City): required, shorter than 40 characters
* Location (State): required
* Cuisine: required
* Rating: required
* Image: required, is a valid url
* Description: required, must not be empty

Title: As a User, when I head to the root URL (i.e. '/') I should see the Homepage
Description:
Set up a route so that when the user hits the root (e.g. http://localhost:3000/) they are redirected to the Homepage.

__Acceptance Criteria:__
* Going to '/' redirects you to the Homepage.

Title: As a User, when I head to '/restaurants/new' I should get the New page
Description:
Set up a route so that when the user hits '/restaurants/new' (e.g. http://localhost:3000/restaurants/new) they are redirected to the New page.

__Acceptance Criteria:__
* Going to '/new' redirects you to the New page.

Title: As a User, when I head to '/restaurants' I should be redirected to the root url
Description:
Set up a route so that when the user hits '/restaurants' (e.g. http://localhost:3000/restaurants), where there is NO id, they are redirected back to the Homepage.

__Acceptance Criteria:__
* Going to '/restaurants' sends you to the Homepage

Title: As a User, when I head to '/restaurants/:id' I should get the Show page
Description:
Set up a route so that when the user hits '/restaurants/:id' (e.g. http://localhost:3000/restaurants/1), where :id is any number, they are redirected to the Show page. For now, just go to the static Show page.

__Acceptance Criteria:__
* Going to '/restaurants/:id' sends you to the Show page

Title: As a User, when I head to '/restaurants/:id/edit' I should get the Edit page
Description:
Set up a route so that when the user hits '/restaurants/:id/edit' (e.g. http://localhost:3000/restaurants/1/edit), where :id is any number, they are redirected to the Edit page. For now, just go to the static Edit page.

__Acceptance Criteria:__
* Going to '/restaurants/:id/edit' sends you to the Edit page
